abstract: With its acquisition of ReCaptcha, Google will use “human computation” to help scan old library books.
snippet: With its acquisition of ReCaptcha, Google will use “human computation” to help scan old library books.
lead_paragraph: Acknowledging once again that humans are better than computer algorithms at some tasks, Google said on Wednesday that it had acquired ReCaptcha, a start-up that grew out of a research project at Carnegie Mellon, for an undisclosed amount.

headline.main: Google Buys Service That Uses Humans to Digitize Books
